page.title: 05GOINGS ON IN DEFYNNOG
page.content: This is about some of the things that go on in Defynnog. In farming the people keep animals like cows and have lots of land. At night some people like to go to have a drink and to enjoy themselves in the Tanners Arms or the Lion; the Lion is about eight hundred years old. Also in Defynnog there is a forge and a smithy which are run by brothers; Paul Denis and Ian Denis. There is also a brass rubbing centre, which we visited last week. Daddy some times goes to the antiques place in Defynnog, he is looking for a big pine table. There is also a little post office that shares the old court house and police station with the brass rubbing centre. In my opinion Defynnog is a nice place to live. (Ceri David)
